channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large clumps of grass and weeds have grown between paving slabs and house boundaries, 6th July
item.description:
Every time the grass verge is cut the cuttings are allowed to go everywhere, when before they were blown back onto the verge. Now they accummalate against house boundaries and take root between paving slabs. At the junction of Blenheim Road and Canterbury Ave large clumps of grass have formed creating trip hazards especially for the partially sighted, elderly and infirm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ground starting to sink, 6th July
item.description:
Started small dip but quickly has got lower and wider. Causes vehicle to bump down it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fky tipping of domestic waste by bins at tip of Ledrington Road, SE19, 6th July
item.description:
As ever, Ledrington Road is being used a a dumping ground by fly tippers. This has appeared overnight and obviously is a bad example while there are concerts on in the park and many visitors to the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ledrington Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large cupboard dumped on morning of 6th July 202, 6th July
item.description:
Cupboard dumped in broad daylight - fly tippers ran off before they could be stopped. Very large and possibly quite dangerous for pedestrians. Children could be tempted to climb on it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beresford Road, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox cub near to recycling bin., 6th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wanley Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Mouse in the communal garden, 6th July
item.description:
Hi Lately I have seen lots of mice in the communal garden and in my garden, this is the first time I have seen mice, how do we tackle this issue, can the council do anything to overcome this issue before it gets worse, don't want mice ending in our flats.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London

item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Large amount of rubbish in black plastic sacks on the pavement of Lower Road opposite Asda Store, 6th July
item.description:
On the stretch of pavement opposite the Asda Store, between No's 248 - 266 Lower Road Belvedere DA17, there are black plastic sacks filled with rubbish. Some are split open causing a complete mess along the pavement. Would arrangements be put in place to remove the black plastic sacks & the surrounding area cleared of the residual waste as soon as practical.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
